indications: Indications see under Dose and under preparations
name: URSODEOXYCHOLIC ACID
breadcrumbs: 1.9.1 Drugs affecting biliary composition and flow
cautions:
Cautions 
(From 1.9.1 Drugs affecting biliary composition and flow: British National Formulary)
it should be used cautiously in those with liver disease (but see below). Patients should be given dietary advice (including avoidance of excessive cholesterol and calories) and they require radiological monitoring. Long-term prophylaxis may be needed after complete dissolution of the gallstones has been confirmed because they may recur in up to 25% of patients within one year of stopping treatment.; interactions: Appendix 1 (bile acids)
side-effects:
Side-effects diarrhoea; very rarely abdominal
pain, gallstone calcification, urticaria; also reported nausea, vomiting, pruritus
doses:
Dissolution of gallstones, 8–12 mg/kg daily as a single
dose at bedtime or in two divided doses, for up to
2 years; treatment is continued for 3–4 months after
stones dissolve
Primary biliary cirrhosis, see under Ursofalk®
pregnancy: Pregnancy no evidence of harm but manufacturer advises avoid
